docs.title: SpineLite
docs.text: Drag-and-drop Spine character customization for Unity.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Equipment System - Helmet, armor, weapons, capes, and more
  • Color Tinting - Skin, hair, eyes, armor with full color control
  • Animation Support - Automatic weapon-compatible animation switching
  • Save/Load - JSON and file-based character persistence
  • Editor Preview - See changes in real-time without Play mode

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
Add SpineLiteController to your Spine character, then:

var controller = GetComponent<SpineLiteController>();

controller.Helmet   = "head/Warrior_Helmet_T1";
controller.Armor    = "body/Leather_Armor";
controller.MainHand = "weapons/Sword_1H";
controller.SkinTint = new Color(0.9f, 0.8f, 0.7f);

No-code alternative: Attach SpineLiteButton to any UI Button and set Property/Value in the Inspector.

docs.title: What's Included
docs.text: The demo scene is optional - your model prefab stays clean with just SpineLiteController.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Unity 6 (6000.0.23f1 or later)
  • Spine Unity Runtime 4.2+
  • TextMeshPro (for UI components)

docs.title: Support
docs.text:
• GitHub Issues

docs.title: Character Creator
docs.text:
using UnityEngine;

public class CharacterCreator : MonoBehaviour
{
    public SpineLiteController controller;

    public void SetWarrior()
    {
        controller.Helmet   = "head/Warrior_Helmet_T1";
        controller.Armor    = "body/Plate_Armor";
        controller.MainHand = "weapons/Sword_1H";
        controller.OffHand  = "shields/Metal_Shield";
        controller.ArmorTint = new Color(0.5f, 0.5f, 0.6f);
    }

    public void SetMage()
    {
        controller.Helmet   = "";
        controller.Armor    = "body/Mage_Robe";
        controller.MainHand = "weapons/Staff_2H";
        controller.OffHand  = "";
        controller.ArmorTint = new Color(0.3f, 0.2f, 0.5f);
    }

    public void SetArcher()
    {
        controller.Helmet   = "head/Hood";
        controller.Armor    = "body/Leather_Armor";
        controller.MainHand = "weapons/Bow";
        controller.OffHand  = "";
        controller.ArmorTint = new Color(0.4f, 0.3f, 0.2f);
    }
}

docs.title: Save System
docs.text:
using UnityEngine;
using System.IO;

public class SaveManager : MonoBehaviour
{
    public SpineLiteController controller;
    private string savePath;

    void Start()
    {
        savePath = Path.Combine(Application.persistentDataPath, "saves");
        Directory.CreateDirectory(savePath);
    }

    public void Save(string name)
    {
        string json = controller.ToJson();
        File.WriteAllText(Path.Combine(savePath, name + ".json"), json);
    }

    public void Load(string name)
    {
        string path = Path.Combine(savePath, name + ".json");
        if (File.Exists(path))
            controller.FromJson(File.ReadAllText(path));
    }
}

docs.title: Animation Controller
docs.text:
using UnityEngine;

public class AnimationController : MonoBehaviour
{
    public SpineLiteController controller;

    void Update()
    {
        // Auto-play compatible idle when idle
        if (Input.GetKeyDown(KeyCode.I))
            controller.PlayCompatibleIdle();

        // Attack animation
        if (Input.GetKeyDown(KeyCode.Space))
            controller.PlayAnimation("melee/M1_short_weapon", false);

        // Stop animation
        if (Input.GetKeyDown(KeyCode.S))
            controller.StopAnimation();
    }
}

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: This guide will help you set up SpineLite in your Unity project.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
1. Import the SpineLite package from the Unity Asset Store
  2. The package will be installed at Assets/LandoGames/

docs.title: Package Contents
docs.text:
LandoGames/
├── Scripts/
│   ├── ControllerLite/       # Core components (keep these)
│   │   ├── SpineLiteController.cs
│   │   ├── SpineLiteButton.cs
│   │   └── SpineLiteAction.cs
│   ├── Gallery/              # Model Gallery (optional)
│   └── Examples/             # Demo scripts (safe to delete)
├── Prefabs/
│   └── Characters/           # Model prefabs
├── Scenes/
│   ├── Demo.unity            # Button showcase
│   └── ModelGallery.unity    # Model browser
├── Data/                     # Saved appearances
└── Documentation/

docs.title: Prefab Structure
docs.text:
Each character prefab contains:

HumanFemaleMage (Prefab)
├── SkeletonAnimation         # Spine component
├── SpineLiteController       # Customization controller
└── SpineLiteInfo (optional)  # Metadata component

What you can delete:

  • SpineLiteDemoUI.cs - Demo scene script only
  • Demo.unity - Example scene
  • Examples/ folder - Demo scripts

What to keep:

  • ControllerLite/ folder - Core functionality
  • Model prefabs
  • Gallery/ folder (if using Model Gallery)

docs.title: Step 1: Add the Controller
docs.text:
1. Select your Spine character GameObject (with SkeletonAnimation)
  2. Add Component → SpineLite Controller
  3. The controller auto-detects the SkeletonAnimation component

docs.title: Step 2: Discover Skins
docs.text:
Click Discover Skins in the Inspector to populate the available equipment lists.

The controller automatically categorizes skins by prefix:

Prefix Category skin/ Base Skins face/hair/ Hair Styles face/beard/ Beard Styles face/eyes/ Eye Styles head/ Helmets body/ Armor legs/ Leg Armor accessories/cape/ Capes weapons/ Weapons shields/ Shields

docs.title: Step 3: Configure Appearance
docs.text:
Use the Inspector dropdowns to select:

  • Base Skin - The nude/base skin
  • Hair Style - Hair attachment
  • Equipment - Helmet, armor, legs, cape
  • Weapons - Main hand and off-hand

docs.title: Using SpineLiteButton (No-Code)
docs.text: For UI-driven customization without writing code:

docs.title: 1. Create a Button
docs.text:
1. Right-click in Hierarchy → UI → Button
  2. Add Component → SpineLite Button

docs.title: 2. Configure Find Mode
docs.text:
Find Mode determines how the button locates the controller:

Mode Use Case Find In Scene Single character - finds first controller in scene Find In Parent Multiple characters - searches up the hierarchy Manual Drag the controller reference directly Find By Name Find controller by GameObject name

Multiple Characters

If you have multiple characters in your scene, use Manual or Find In Parent to target the correct one.

docs.title: 3. Configure the Button
docs.text: Property Description Property Type What to change (Helmet, Armor, MainHand, etc.) String Value The skin path to apply Color Value For color properties

docs.title: 4. Property Types
docs.text:
Equipment:

  • Helmet, Armor, Legs, Cape, Overcoat, Trinket
  • MainHand, OffHand

Body:

  • HairStyle, BeardStyle, EyeStyle, EyeGear

Colors:

  • SkinTone, HairColor, BeardColor, EyeColor
  • ArmorTint, BootsTint, CapeTint

Actions:

  • Randomize - Randomize everything
  • RandomizeEquipment - Randomize equipment only
  • RandomizeColors - Randomize colors only
  • ResetToDefault - Reset to defaults
  • PlayAnimation - Play a specific animation

docs.title: SpineLiteButton
docs.text: A no-code component for UI buttons that control character customization.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: SpineLiteButton lets you create character customization buttons without writing code. Just add it to any UI Button and configure in the Inspector.

docs.title: Target
docs.text: Property Type Description targetMode TargetMode How to find the controller targetController SpineLiteController Manual reference (if mode is Manual) targetName string GameObject name (if mode is FindByName)

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: Property Type Description configMode ConfigMode Inline or ScriptableObject actionAsset SpineLiteAction Reusable action asset propertyType PropertyType What property to change stringValue string Skin/animation path value colorValue Color Color value (for tints) loopAnimation bool Loop animation (for PlayAnimation)

docs.title: Visual Feedback
docs.text: Property Type Description autoUpdateText bool Auto-update button text displayText string Custom display text showSelectionHighlight bool Highlight when selected selectedColor Color Button color when selected normalColor Color Button color when not selected

docs.text: Property Type Description onBeforeApply UnityEvent Called before applying onAfterApply UnityEvent Called after applying

docs.title: TargetMode
docs.text: Value Description Manual Use the assigned targetController FindInParent Search up the hierarchy FindInScene Find any controller in scene FindByName Find by GameObject name

docs.title: Events Example
docs.text:
Listen to button events:

public class ButtonListener : MonoBehaviour
{
    public SpineLiteButton equipmentButton;

    void Start()
    {
        equipmentButton.onBeforeApply.AddListener(OnBeforeEquip);
        equipmentButton.onAfterApply.AddListener(OnAfterEquip);
    }

    void OnBeforeEquip()
    {
        Debug.Log("About to change equipment...");
    }

    void OnAfterEquip()
    {
        Debug.Log("Equipment changed!");
        // Play sound, show particle effect, etc.
    }
}

docs.title: SpineLiteController
docs.text: The main component for controlling Spine character appearance.

docs.title: Equipment
docs.text: Property Type Description BaseSkin string Base nude skin (e.g., "skin/nude_T1") HairStyle string Hair attachment path BeardStyle string Beard attachment path EyeStyle string Eye style path EyeGear string Eye gear (glasses, eyepatch) Helmet string Head armor path Armor string Body armor path Legs string Leg armor path Cape string Cape/cloak path Overcoat string Overcoat path Trinket string Trinket accessory path MainHand string Main hand weapon path OffHand string Off-hand item/shield path

docs.title: Colors
docs.text: Property Type Description SkinTint Color Skin tone color HairTint Color Hair color BeardTint Color Beard color EyeTint Color Eye color ArmorTint Color Armor color overlay WeaponTint Color Weapon color overlay BootsTint Color Boots/footwear color CapeTint Color Cape color

docs.title: Animation
docs.text: Property Type Description CurrentAnimation string Current animation name LoopAnimation bool Whether animation loops IsPlaying bool Is animation playing (read-only)

docs.title: RebuildAppearance()
docs.text:
Rebuilds the combined skin with all current equipment. Called automatically when properties change.

controller.RebuildAppearance();

docs.title: ApplyColors()
docs.text:
Reapplies all color tints. Called automatically when color properties change.

controller.ApplyColors();

docs.title: Randomize()
docs.text:
Randomizes all equipment, hair, and colors.

controller.Randomize();

Note

Armor and eyes are always set to valid items (never "none").

docs.title: RandomizeEquipment()
docs.text:
Randomizes only equipment (armor, weapons, helmet, etc.). Colors remain unchanged.

controller.RandomizeEquipment();

docs.title: RandomizeColors()
docs.text:
Randomizes only colors (skin, hair, armor tints). Equipment remains unchanged.

controller.RandomizeColors();

docs.title: ResetToDefaults()
docs.text:
Resets character to default appearance (nude, no equipment, white colors).

controller.ResetToDefaults();

docs.title: PlayAnimation(string name, bool loop)
docs.text:
Plays the specified animation.

controller.PlayAnimation("idle", true);
controller.PlayAnimation("melee/M1_short_weapon", false);

docs.title: StopAnimation()
docs.text:
Stops the current animation and returns to setup pose.

controller.StopAnimation();

docs.title: PlayCompatibleIdle()
docs.text:
Plays the best idle animation for the current weapon.

// Auto-selects idle_hold or idle_combat based on weapon
controller.PlayCompatibleIdle();

docs.title: ToJson(bool prettyPrint = true)
docs.text:
Exports current appearance to JSON string.

string json = controller.ToJson();
// Save to PlayerPrefs, file, server, etc.

docs.title: FromJson(string json)
docs.text:
Loads appearance from JSON string.

string json = PlayerPrefs.GetString("CharacterSave");
controller.FromJson(json);

docs.title: SaveToFile(string path = null)
docs.text:
Saves appearance to a JSON file. Uses default path if not specified.

// Default path (Assets/LandoGames/Data/)
controller.SaveToFile();

// Custom path
controller.SaveToFile("Assets/MyGame/Saves/character.json");

docs.title: LoadFromFile()
docs.text:
Loads appearance from the assigned TextAsset.

// Requires Appearance Data File to be assigned in Inspector
controller.LoadFromFile();

docs.title: GetAppearanceData()
docs.text:
Returns a SpineLiteAppearanceData object with all current settings.

var data = controller.GetAppearanceData();

docs.title: ApplyAppearanceData(SpineLiteAppearanceData data)
docs.text:
Applies settings from a data object.

controller.ApplyAppearanceData(data);

docs.title: DiscoverSkins()
docs.text:
Scans the skeleton for available skins and categorizes them.

controller.DiscoverSkins();
// Now controller.helmets, controller.armors, etc. are populated

docs.title: DiscoverAnimations()
docs.text:
Scans the skeleton for available animations.

controller.DiscoverAnimations();
// Now controller.availableAnimations is populated

docs.title: Example: Full Setup
docs.text:
using UnityEngine;
using SpineLite;

public class CharacterSetup : MonoBehaviour
{
    private SpineLiteController controller;

    void Start()
    {
        controller = GetComponent<SpineLiteController>();

        // Set appearance
        controller.HairStyle = "face/hair/Long_Hair_01";
        controller.Armor = "body/Leather_Armor";
        controller.MainHand = "weapons/Sword_1H";

        // Set colors
        controller.SkinTint = new Color(0.9f, 0.8f, 0.7f);
        controller.HairTint = new Color(0.4f, 0.2f, 0.1f);

        // Play animation
        controller.PlayAnimation("idle", true);
    }

    public void SaveCharacter()
    {
        string json = controller.ToJson();
        PlayerPrefs.SetString("MyCharacter", json);
        PlayerPrefs.Save();
    }

    public void LoadCharacter()
    {
        if (PlayerPrefs.HasKey("MyCharacter"))
        {
            controller.FromJson(PlayerPrefs.GetString("MyCharacter"));
        }
    }
}

docs.title: Animations
docs.text: Play animations and auto-switch based on equipped weapons.

docs.title: Basic Playback
docs.text:
controller.PlayAnimation("idle", true);              // Loop
controller.PlayAnimation("melee/M1_short_weapon", false);  // Once
controller.StopAnimation();

docs.title: Weapon-Compatible Animations
docs.text:
When weapons are equipped, SpineLite auto-selects compatible animations:

// This auto-selects the best idle for current weapon
controller.PlayCompatibleIdle();

The controller checks your equipped weapon and plays the matching idle animation automatically.

docs.title: Dominant Hand (Weapon Priority)
docs.text:
SpineLite chooses compatible animations based on the dominant weapon. If both hands have weapons, the off-hand (left/back hand) wins and its animation set is used.

Example:

  • Off-hand = Torch
  • Main-hand = Sword
  • → Walk uses torch-style animations, not sword walk

This lets you swap weapons without manually picking the animation set.

docs.title: Animation Naming Conventions
docs.text: Animations follow a naming pattern that indicates weapon compatibility:

docs.title: Idle Animations
docs.text: Animation Weapon Type idle No weapon visible idle_combat/1H One-handed weapon idle_combat/2H Two-handed weapon idle_combat/bow Bow idle_hold/1H Holding 1H casually idle_hold/2H Holding 2H casually

docs.title: Attack Animations
docs.text: Animation Description melee/M1_short_weapon Quick attack with short weapon melee/M1_long_weapon Attack with long weapon melee/M1_2H Two-handed attack ranged/bow_shoot Bow shot ranged/throw Throwing attack

docs.title: Other Categories
docs.text: Category Prefix Description Walk walk/ Walking animations Run run/ Running animations Block block/ Blocking with shield Cast cast/ Spell casting Death death/ Death animations Hit hit/ Taking damage

docs.title: How Auto-Selection Works
docs.text:
When you call PlayCompatibleIdle():

  1. Controller checks MainHand weapon
  2. Determines weapon type (1H, 2H, bow, etc.)
  3. Finds matching idle_combat/ or idle_hold/ animation
  4. Falls back to base idle if no match
// Example: Sword equipped
controller.MainHand = "weapons/Sword_1H";
controller.PlayCompatibleIdle();  // Plays idle_combat/1H

// Example: Staff equipped
controller.MainHand = "weapons/Staff_2H";
controller.PlayCompatibleIdle();  // Plays idle_combat/2H

// Example: No weapon
controller.MainHand = "";
controller.PlayCompatibleIdle();  // Plays idle

docs.title: Animation Discovery
docs.text:
To see all available animations on your model:

controller.DiscoverAnimations();

// Now you can iterate available animations
foreach (var anim in controller.availableAnimations)
{
    Debug.Log(anim);
}

Or use the Inspector - click Discover Animations to populate the list.

docs.title: Playing Specific Animations
docs.text:
// Play idle animation (looping)
controller.PlayAnimation("idle", true);

// Play attack animation (once)
controller.PlayAnimation("melee/M1_short_weapon", false);

// Stop current animation
controller.StopAnimation();

docs.title: SpineLiteButton for Animations
docs.text:
Use the no-code approach:

  1. Add SpineLiteButton to a UI Button
  2. Set Property Type = PlayAnimation
  3. Set String Value = animation name (e.g., "idle")
  4. Set Loop Animation = true or false

docs.title: Color Tinting
docs.text: Apply color tints to different parts of the character.

docs.title: Available Tints
docs.text: Tint Affects SkinTint All body parts with nude attachments HairTint Hair slots BeardTint Beard slots EyeTint Eye slots ArmorTint Non-nude armor (torso, arms, legs) BootsTint Feet/boot slots CapeTint Cape slots WeaponTint Equipped weapons

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
controller.SkinTint = new Color(0.9f, 0.8f, 0.7f);
controller.HairTint = new Color(0.3f, 0.2f, 0.1f);
controller.ArmorTint = new Color(0.4f, 0.4f, 0.5f);

To remove tint, use white or clear: 

controller.ArmorTint = Color.white; // No tint

docs.title: Equipment System
docs.text: SpineLite uses Spine's skin system to manage equipment.

docs.title: Equipment Slots
docs.text: Slot Prefix Example Base Skin skin/ skin/nude_T1 Hair face/hair/ face/hair/Long_Hair_01 Beard face/beard/ face/beard/Full_Beard Eyes face/eyes/ face/eyes/Blue_Eyes Helmet head/ head/Warrior_Helmet_T1 Armor body/ body/Leather_Armor Legs legs/ legs/Leather_Pants Cape accessories/cape/ accessories/cape/Red_Cape Main Weapon weapons/ weapons/Sword_1H Off-Hand shields/ or offhand/ shields/Wooden_Shield

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
controller.Helmet = "head/Warrior_Helmet_T1";
controller.Armor = "body/Leather_Armor";
controller.MainHand = "weapons/Sword_1H";

To unequip, set to empty string: 

controller.Helmet = "";

docs.title: Save & Load
docs.text: Save and restore character appearance using JSON or file-based persistence.

docs.title: Quick Reference
docs.text:
// File-based
controller.SaveToFile();
controller.LoadFromFile();

// JSON-based
string json = controller.ToJson();
controller.FromJson(json);

docs.title: SaveToFile()
docs.text:
Saves appearance to a JSON file in your project:

// Uses default path (Assets/LandoGames/Data/)
controller.SaveToFile();

// Or specify custom path
controller.SaveToFile("Assets/MyGame/Saves/character.json");

docs.title: LoadFromFile()
docs.text:
Loads appearance from the assigned TextAsset:

// Loads from the TextAsset assigned in Inspector
controller.LoadFromFile();

Assigning the Data File

In the Inspector, drag your saved JSON file to the Appearance Data File field on SpineLiteController.

docs.title: JSON-Based Saves
docs.text: For runtime saves (PlayerPrefs, server, etc.):

docs.title: ToJson()
docs.text:
string json = controller.ToJson();

// Save to PlayerPrefs
PlayerPrefs.SetString("CharacterSave", json);
PlayerPrefs.Save();

// Or send to server
StartCoroutine(SendToServer(json));

docs.title: FromJson()
docs.text:
// Load from PlayerPrefs
string json = PlayerPrefs.GetString("CharacterSave");
controller.FromJson(json);

docs.title: JSON Format
docs.text:
{
  "baseSkin": "skin/nude_T1",
  "hairStyle": "face/hair/Long_Hair_01",
  "beardStyle": "",
  "eyeStyle": "face/eyes/Blue_Eyes",
  "helmet": "head/Warrior_Helmet_T1",
  "armor": "body/Leather_Armor",
  "legs": "legs/Leather_Pants",
  "cape": "",
  "mainHand": "weapons/Sword_1H",
  "offHand": "shields/Wooden_Shield",
  "skinTint": [0.9, 0.8, 0.7, 1.0],
  "hairTint": [0.3, 0.2, 0.1, 1.0],
  "armorTint": [0.4, 0.4, 0.5, 1.0],
  "savedAt": "2026-01-21 12:00:00",
  "version": "1.1"
}

docs.title: AppearanceData Object
docs.text:
For more control, use the data object directly:

// Get current appearance as data object
SpineLiteAppearanceData data = controller.GetAppearanceData();

// Modify it
data.helmet = "head/Wizard_Hat";
data.armorTint = new float[] { 0.2f, 0.3f, 0.8f, 1.0f };

// Apply it back
controller.ApplyAppearanceData(data);

docs.title: Save Manager Example
docs.text:
using UnityEngine;
using System.IO;

public class SaveManager : MonoBehaviour
{
    public SpineLiteController controller;
    private string savePath;

    void Start()
    {
        savePath = Path.Combine(Application.persistentDataPath, "saves");
        Directory.CreateDirectory(savePath);
    }

    public void Save(string characterName)
    {
        string json = controller.ToJson();
        string path = Path.Combine(savePath, characterName + ".json");
        File.WriteAllText(path, json);
        Debug.Log($"Saved to: {path}");
    }

    public void Load(string characterName)
    {
        string path = Path.Combine(savePath, characterName + ".json");
        if (File.Exists(path))
        {
            string json = File.ReadAllText(path);
            controller.FromJson(json);
            Debug.Log($"Loaded: {characterName}");
        }
    }

    public string[] GetSaveFiles()
    {
        return Directory.GetFiles(savePath, "*.json");
    }
}
